title: How to Save a Video Through Inspect on Chrome, Firefox, Edge, & Safari

steps.title: Go to a website with a video.
steps.content: Go to a website with a video. Not all web browsers allow you to use the "Inspect element" or "Inspect" feature, but you can use these steps in Google Chrome , Microsoft Edge , and Mozilla Firefox. The steps are nearly identical in all three. This method does not work with most popular streaming video sites, including YouTube, Instagram, or Netflix. According to Meshesha, a YouTube downloader site is the easiest way to download a YouTube video. "These sites will grab the video using the URL and convert it into a downloadable video or audio-only format," he explains. Check out our guide to Downloading YouTube Videos and Downloading YouTube Videos without Software to learn how!

steps.title: Open Inspect Element.
steps.content: Open Inspect Element. On most browsers, you can right-click the page and select Inspect Element or Inspect . You can also use the F12 key or try these steps: Click the menu icon with three dots ( ⋮ or ⋯ ) or three lines ( ☰ ). Click More tools . Click Developer tools .

steps.title: Click the Network tab.
steps.content: Click the Network tab. It's at the top of the developer tools window. It has an icon that resembles the Wi-Fi icon (a dot with arching lines). There are multiple tabs that say "Network," so make sure you're choosing the one at the very top of the Inspect panel.

steps.title: Click the filter icon.
steps.content: Click the filter icon. It's the funnel icon at the top of the page. Skip this step if you are using Firefox.

steps.title: Click the Media tab.
steps.content: Click the Media tab. It's below or next to the "Filter" search bar at the top.

steps.title: Play the video.
steps.content: Play the video. You should see a URL to the video in the developer tools window. It should have a video file extension such as ".mp4", ".mov", or ".avi." You can also try searching for "watch" or "video" instead. If you do not see a URL to the video, it may be encrypted. In this case, you will need to use another method to download the video. steps.title: Play the video in a new tab.
steps.content: Play the video in a new tab. To do so, right-click or control-click the URL in the developer tools window and click Open in new tab .

steps.title: Click ⋮ on the video playback screen.
steps.content: Click ⋮ on the video playback screen. It's in the lower-right corner. This displays the More menu. If you don't see an icon with three dots, right-click or control-click the video and click Save video as... .

steps.title: Click Download.
steps.content: Click Download . It's in the more menu. This downloads the video. You can find the videos you downloaded in your Downloads folder by default.

steps.title: Open the Advanced Settings pages in Safari.
steps.content: Open the Advanced Settings pages in Safari. Use the following steps to do so: Click Safari in the menu bar at the top. Click Settings or Preferences . Click the Advanced tab.

steps.title: Check the box next to "Show develop menu in menu bar".
steps.content: Check the box next to "Show develop menu in menu bar". It's at the bottom of the window. This allows you to inspect element in Safari.

steps.title: Go to a website with a video.
steps.content: Go to a website with a video. Use Google to search for the website, or enter the URL in the address bar at the top. This method will not work with popular websites like YouTube or Netflix that have the source code well encrypted. According to Meshesha, the best way to download a YouTube video is to search the web for "youtube download site" and select the first link. Just keep in mind that some YouTube downloaders have a lot of ads and may not be the most trustworthy—always keep your antivirus software enabled when you use video downloaders.

steps.title: Control-click the page and select Inspect Element.
steps.content: Control-click the page and select Inspect Element . This opens the developer options panel.

steps.title: Press ⌘ Command+F and search for media formats.
steps.content: Press ⌘ Command + F and search for media formats. This will open a search bar you can use to search the website code. Enter video formats in the search. Common formats include "mp4," "mov," and "avi."

steps.title: Highlight and copy the video URL.
steps.content: Highlight and copy the video URL. Once you locate the video URL, highlight it. Then right-click and select Copy . This video URL will end with a video file extension such as ".mp4," ".mov", or ".avi." You can also try searching for "watch" or "video" instead. If you can't find a URL for the video file, it may be encrypted.

steps.title: Paste the video URL in a new tab.
steps.content: Paste the video URL in a new tab. Click the plus (+) icon in the upper-right corner to open a new tab. Then, paste the video URL into the address bar. This will play the video in a new tab.

steps.title: Right-click (or Control-click) the video and click Download Video as.
steps.content: Right-click (or Control-click) the video and click Download Video as . This allows you to save the video to your computer. Enter a name for the video file and click Save . [1] X Research source By default, your downloaded files can be found in your Downloads folder.
